plants.name: Rosa chinensis
plants.description: A species of rose native to Southwest China that has contributed greatly to the development of modern roses. It produces profuse blooms that come in various shades of pink, red, and white. Known for its continuous flowering habit in warm climates.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring through summer (May to September)
plants.location: Subtropical and temperate regions worldwide, especially in East Asia and gardens globally
plants.funFact: The China Rose is one of the ancestors of most modern garden roses and was introduced to Europe in the late 18th century.

plants.name: Lupinus polyphyllus
plants.description: A tall, perennial flowering plant that produces dense spikes of pea-like flowers. It enhances soil fertility by fixing nitrogen and is popular in wildflower meadows and gardens.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to mid-summer (May to July)
plants.location: Native to western North America, widely naturalized in Europe and New Zealand
plants.funFact: Bigleaf Lupines have the ability to improve soil health through nitrogen fixation, benefiting surrounding plants.

plants.name: Delphinium elatum
plants.description: These showy perennials produce tall spikes of vibrant flowers that attract pollinators. They prefer cooler temperate zones and thrive in garden borders.
plants.location: Native to Europe and Asia, widely cultivated in temperate gardens
plants.funFact: Delphiniums have toxic seeds and foliage, which help deter herbivores.

plants.name: Nymphaea alba
plants.description: An aquatic plant with large fragrant white flowers that float on the water‚Äôs surface. It's common in ponds and slow-moving water bodies.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring to summer (May to August)
plants.location: Native to temperate regions of Europe, North Africa, and Asia
plants.funFact: Water lilies have specialized pads that can move water and light to optimize photosynthesis.
